textos_fuente.text: About Us - Pembroke Golf Club Subscribe to Our Public Newsletter Book Online or Call For Tee Times 613-732-1665 Book a Tee Time Online HOME ABOUT US GOLF PHOTO ALBUM EVENTS JUNIORS MEMBERS CONTACT US A Bit of History The Pembroke Golf Club was established in 1922 as a nine hole golf course. It remained that way until 1982 when the second nine was added by architect Graham Cooke. Today, the golf course stretches over 6,700 years in a full championship layout. There are four sets of tees for a variety of skill levels. Competitive History Men, women and junior members of the Pembroke Golf Club are involved in a variety of competitive events in the Ottawa Valley. As a member of the Ontario Golf Association and the Ottawa Valley Golf Association (OVGA), the Pembroke Golf Club participates in the annual Intersectional matches. These OVGA events take place throughout the region and clubs move up or down in various levels given their results. These head-to-head match play events have a number of different categories and all members categories of our club (men, senior men, women, senior women and juniors) compete. Also in the Ottawa Valley are a number of annual team competitions. The storied Gordon Cup is a 14-man team event where male members participate in a number of qualifying rounds throughout the year in order to earn a position on the team. The event is held annually on Labour Day weekend and sees 14-man teams from Pembroke, Deep River, Mississippi, Arnprior and Renfrew golf clubs battle it out for Ottawa Valley bragging rights. The club has won the Gordon Cup twice in the past six years (unbelieveably, both time in a playoff!) Pembroke Golf Club was a founding member of this historic event. On the women's side, the women members also go through a season-long qualifiying to earn a spot on the team to compete for the O'Brien Cup. This is also a long-time, traditional event within which Pembroke's teams have a rich history in competiting and celebrating wins. The event also travels to clubs throughout the Valley where 12-member teams of women compete annually in August. There are a number of other team events that allow all member groups, regardless of age or ability, to represent the Cub in fun, competitive tournaments held throughout the Valley. These include the Ashley-Brown Cup (senior men), the Quattrocchi Cup (7+ handicap men), the Fraser Cup (10+ handicap men), the Longpre Cup (15+ handicap men) and the Blakely Cup (juniors). In addition, many of our members compete at events in the Ottawa zone including regional and provincial championships. The Pembroke Golf Club has a great history of producing competitive golfers in all categories. The Professional Staff Dan Shields, CPGA Head Professional and Owner Dan grew up in Pembroke and has been back in the area for 26 years. In addition to operating the Pembroke Golf Club for the past 20 years, he just completed his 25th season of overseeing the operation of the Island Brae Golf Club. After completing his post-secondary education at McGill and Carleton universities, Dan finished the requirements to become a Head Golf Professional in the Canadian Professional Golfers’ Association (Canadian PGA). He began working in the golf industry at 15 years of age and has been involved in the golf business for over 30 years. He worked as an Associate Golf Professional at two of the most prestigious golf courses in the country – The Royal Ottawa Golf Club and the Thornhill Country Club. Dan also spent five years as the Golf Professional/Manager at the Arnprior Golf Club prior to purchasing the Island Brae Golf Club. He has extensive experience in all areas of the business including: teaching, tournament organization, merchandising, membership, promotion, accounting, human resources, food and beverage operations, golf course financing, golf course maintenance, etc. 253 Golf Course Road Pembroke, Ontario K8A 7M1 Phone: 613-732-1665 Email: pembrokegolf@bellnet.ca © 2025 Copyright Pembroke Golf Club | All rights reserved Designed by Forward Thinking

News & Media Member Login REGISTER HERE Give Search for: Contact 2025-08-25T10:48:20-06:00 Contact Us Lakeland Hills YMCA is community-centered, bringing people of all ages and backgrounds together, to nurture potential and mobilize local communities to effect lasting and meaningful change. We look forward to helping you with your needs and answering any questions you may have. Feel free to contact us via the form below or through a membership representative at one of our local YMCAs. Δ Close Lakeland Hills Family YMCA 100 Fanny Road Mountain Lakes, NJ Phone: 973-334-2820 membership@lhymca.com Frequently Asked Questions What are your facility hours? Our hours are: Monday – Friday 5:00 A.M – 10:30 P.M. Saturday – Sunday 7:00 A.M. – 6:00 P.M. Directions Can I access other YMCA’s with my Lakeland Hills YMCA membership? Yes. We are proud to offer our members access to YMCA facilities across the United States and Canada that participate in Nationwide Membership. This way, our members can use the Y as often as they like, making it easier to achieve their health and wellness goals. Are group exercise classes available? Yes. We have over 65 weekly classes offered from Yoga to HIT. These classes offer a great workout in a class setting, and are all included with your membership. Can I bring a friend? Yes. As a member, you are given 3 guest passes per year. You can bring a friend up to 3X for free. After that there is a fee. Guests/friends can use facility a max of 3X per year and then must become a member. Is there a trial membership to try out the Y? Yes. We have a 1-Week Trial Membership for free.  After that, we have several options that you can choose as a new member. What benefits do I get with my membership? Full Privilege Membership entitles you to use the pool, basketball gymnasium, Health and Fitness Training Center, general membership locker rooms, as well as group fitness, yoga, spinning classes, and all aqua exercise classes. Plus, three free guest passes per year and a fitness orientation. Some age restrictions apply. Long Term Locker Membership offers full privilege membership plus an assigned locker and towel service in an adult only locker room which includes steam room, sauna and TV. What are the pool hours? For Pool Hours and available swim times, please visit our schedules page where you can download swim times as well as gymnasium and group fitness class times. Do you offer financial assistance? Yes. We offer financial aid to ensure that no one is turned away from a Y program or service due to an inability to pay. Visit our Financial Assistance page for more information. STAY CURIOUS Want to know more about how you can make an impact in the community? Fill out this simple form to learn how to get involved.
